message: by now, when I call "User.new" in my app, it references Rdio's... Even without the "Rdio::" prefix... how can I manage that conflict?
I have a rails app with a "User" model class. I installed the "rdio" gem who contains a "Rdio::User" class
Writing it like this will exclude specific Modules?? Nice! I'll give it a try

Putting :: before the module/class name forces Ruby to look from the top level down. So even if say you're defining a class called Bar in a module called Foo that also has class User, but you want to use the User class from another, you can write ::OtherModule::User to make sure you get the one you actually want.
damn... this all sounds good and seemed to be the solution... but "::User" still references the "Rdio::User" class...
yes... there is. In one of the gem's file...
woah, now that's not very nice :(
@frederickdubois check if there's a "include Rdio" somewhere
It's fixed on github and I pushed a new gem.
